channel.title: TAGSLISTTEMPLATE on From Draenor With Love
channel.description: Recent content in TAGSLISTTEMPLATE on From Draenor With Love

item.title: And We Walked Out Once More Beneath the Stars, II
item.description: Five years ago today, FDWL ended its run. This feels fitting in a way, because the comic also ran for five years. If things had been different, maybe Mike and I wouldn‚Äôt even have remembered this milestone. Or we would‚Äôve and said, ‚ÄúHey, isn‚Äôt that neat.‚Äù Neither of us played World of Warcraft anymore, and this project had been largely lost because the original website was hacked and after a few years of not fixing it, I finally let the domain name lapse.

item.title: Reflections, Part Four
item.description: Five years ago, I thought of a joke that made me laugh. I turned the joke into a single comic featuring my character Vidyala and the character of my friend Rades (aka Mike). I sent it to him to see if he thought it was funny, and whether he might like to do more comics with me. After a lot of brainstorming (especially to come up with the name), From Draenor With Love was born.

item.title: Reflections, Part Three
item.description: And now, Four and Wrathion‚Äôs epilogues. We thought about it long and hard, and we really felt Four deserved a happy ending, living happily ever after in Ogri‚Äôla. Wrathion, on the other hand‚Ä¶well, he‚Äôs got some thinking to do. From Draenor With Love wraps up next week, see you then!

item.title: Reflections, Part Two
item.description: Part 2 of our 4-part epilogue! Bonus points if you recognize Rades‚Äô gift in the first panel. üòâ

item.title: Reflections, Part One
item.description: Bet you didn‚Äôt expect to see Garrosh‚Äôs ugly mug again, huh? You didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd wrap up our story without making Vid draw her favorite orc one last time, did you?? If you don‚Äôt remember what Taran Zhu is referring to, it goes all the way back to the Patch 5.4: Siege of Orgrimmar trailer. Remember, the events of FDWL started when Siege of Orgrimmar began. And now, we examine the aftermath ‚Äî of both stories.

item.title: And We Walked Out Once More Beneath the Stars
item.description: Almost exactly three years ago, we published the first page of our revamped From Draenor With Love. That was so long ago. That was before Warlords of Draenor was even announced! It‚Äôs kind of surreal to even think about. And now, 128 pages later, we‚Äôre drawing to a close. When we set out on this journey, we wanted to explore some themes that we both hold close to our hearts: friendship and family.

item.title: Under the Mid-Point of That Other Sky
Whose Shadow a Single Blow Pierced with Light
item.description: We‚Äôre a week into Legion, and all around me my guildies are talking about Suramar dailies, weird squid world bosses, reputation grinds, and other max-level concerns. Me, I‚Äôm still only level 107, so I‚Äôm just ignoring it all for now! Amusingly, somehow I‚Äôve reached 107 and finished only a single zone, Stormheim. Not via dungeon grinding, either! Just a lot of‚Ä¶meandering about, doing Darkmoon Faire quests, some pet battles, some Archaeology‚Ä¶everything but powerleveling, really.

item.title: The Ravening Beast
item.description: So how was everyone‚Äôs Legion launch experience? Me, I got myself trapped in the underbelly of an Alliance airship with no way out except for hurling myself out the open hatch to the sea below. Then I abandoned the breadcrumb quest into Stormheim to redo it and take more screenshots, but instead ended up stranded out there with no quests available. Then I hearthed back to Dalaran and broke my Tailoring profession quest by doing exactly the same thing.

item.title: Alone in a Dark Wood
item.description: Hey, nice job Kynrind on predicting the return of Vid‚Äôs symbol in the comments last week! üòÄ Yesterday was an interesting one in Azeroth ‚Äî Dalaran was completely missing! And even worse, if you had logged out there, when you logged in you fell to your death! Naturally, I had to do up a little bonus comic commemorating this bizarre moment (based on Kate Beaton‚Äôs original comic here.)

item.title: End of the Road, Part Six
End of the Road, Part Five
item.description: WRATHION NO So how about those Broken Shore and Demon Hunter cinematics?? Man, I sure wish we could get the cinematic team to do a FDWL version. üòâ

item.title: End of the Road, Part Four
End of the Road, Part Three
item.description: Can you really blame Wrathion? It‚Äôs not every day you see a fight like this. /popcorn

item.title: End of the Road, Part Two
item.description: cue Pacific Rim music Like it says, Page 5! A reveal 114 strips pages and almost 3 years in the making. Feels good, man.

item.title: End of the Road, Part One
item.description: SUSPENSE

item.title: Vacation Vid
item.description: I‚Äôm sorry there‚Äôs no ‚Äúregular‚Äù comic this Wednesday! We did our best to get a bunch of them done but the last few pages have been complicated and we‚Äôre only human, and I was going on vacation. Please accept this sketch doodle of vacation mode Vidyala instead. It‚Äôs much more pleasant than the current FDWL reality. We‚Äôll be back with our regular updates next week!

item.title: BRB
item.description: I think Wrathion is my favorite character to write, especially because it‚Äôs so easy to imagine his voice saying the lines, since we heard him so much during Mists of Pandaria. Of course, it helps that his voice actor Aaron Phillips does hilarious things like read out fake Guy Fieri menus.

item.title: Full Circle
item.description: Back to Pandaria. Back to the Vale. It‚Äôs been a long road, but we‚Äôve finally come full circle. Big thanks to Poneria for being our latest Patreon patron! We really appreciate the support! üòÄ

item.title: Home Is Where the Hearth Is
Blinded By The Light
item.description: I have fond memories of using Blinding Light in arenas with Arcane Torrent, Rebuke, and Fist of Justice to just shut down enemy healers for an absurd amount of time. No wonder it got nerfed. Don‚Äôt forget to login soon to reclaim your free Warcraft movie transmogs! Even if you don‚Äôt plan on seeing the movie, the transmogs look great and should fit in well to anyone‚Äôs collection. üòÄ

item.title: The Power of Positive Thinking
item.description: Speaking of going back to Pandaria, I too have found myself back in Kun-Lai and Halfhill lately. Since Brawler‚Äôs Guild is going away in Legion, I‚Äôve been trying to get all the special quests to unlock the Brawler‚Äôs Guild challenge bosses required for Collect Your Deck ‚Äî partially for the achievement, but also for the shirts you get for beating those bosses. Gotta gear up for the wardrobe!

item.title: The FDWL Awakens
item.description: Happy Star Wars Day, and May the Fourth be with you! We don‚Äôt normally skip a week for a special page like this, but when we noticed the date coincidence a few weeks back, we just couldn‚Äôt pass up the opportunity to have a little fun. And now, after seeing what Vid came up with, I think we definitely made the right call. (Sorry Poe, there just wasn‚Äôt room, buddy!)

item.title: Filled With Determination
item.description: Vid sure has a lot to say this week! And I think most of us would tend to agree with much of what she‚Äôs saying. The Horde and Alliance really DO just keep screwing everything up, and both sides are too damn dumb to cooperate and play nice. After all, From Draenor‚Äôs entire whole story is about trying to fix one of our bigger blunders, and restoring the Vale. Sure, Garrosh might have been the one who did the deed, but let‚Äôs face it, Pandaria was doing pretty good on the whole ‚Äúcontrol the Sha by controlling your emotions‚Äù thing before we washed up on shore.

item.title: Happy Noblegarden!
item.description: Happy Noblegarden, everyone! If you‚Äôre a Mage, make sure you go gather enough chocolate eggs to buy the Tome of Polymorph: Rabbit! üòÄ

item.title: Quieter Days
item.description: I‚Äôve been very sick this past week, so we‚Äôre taking a brief pause from the action. In the meantime, readers seemed to really take to the nameless Aldor and Scryer characters on the last few pages! We imagined them as rivals representing opposing factions, sure, but ones where any enmity or opposition had ultimately faded into a comfortably friendly rivalry over the years of defending Shattrath together.

item.title: Together
item.description: COOL AS A CUCUMBER

item.title: A Warm Welcome
item.description: While this was definitely the appropriate Sha response, I can‚Äôt help but be tickled by the mental image of the Sha obediently following Khadgar‚Äôs silly arcane elemental all around Shattrath for like ten minutes, only to fail the quest at the very end because the elemental wandered out of sight or moved around a corner. Man, that quest sucks.

item.title: Colouring Page
item.description: Hey folks, my apologies. Due to some personal stuff I wasn‚Äôt able to get a comic done this week. Please accept instead this colouring page ‚Äì it‚Äôs a slightly edited version of our page 100 comic that you can print out and colour yourself if you‚Äôd like! It was originally available only to our patrons. We‚Äôll be back with the regular comic on schedule next week. (A note from Sean: Though the image appears the same size as any other comic, it is much higher resolution.

item.title: Destiny, Part 2
item.description: Well, maybe some things were simply meant to be.

item.title: Ding!
item.description: Level (page?) 100! Oh shoot, does this mean it‚Äôs time for LFR? Thanks to everyone who‚Äôs been reading FDWL over the years! We really appreciate the support, comments, and company we‚Äôve had along the way! üôÇ

item.title: Urgency
item.description: As we all learned in Warlords, operating without flight is a real drag. Too bad they don‚Äôt have Avianna‚Äôs Feather!

item.title: Eli‚Äôs Coming
item.description: (No, the Sha‚Äôs name isn‚Äôt Eli. It‚Äôs a song reference.) Sorry for the font change for the Sha, but I didn‚Äôt realize that the previous font would be‚Ä¶well, completely unsuitable for longer passages of text. I think this new look fits it pretty well, anyway! The Sha are such interesting enemies. We‚Äôve seen that they clearly thrive and draw strength from negative emotions, but at the same time, they‚Äôre obviously capable of corrupting creatures and people as well.

item.title: Outmatched
item.description: Being almost a full expansion past Mists of Pandaria, it‚Äôs easy to forget just how freaking creepy the Sha are! And their weird shadowy, void-like essence always did strike me as one of the more sinister forms of attack. Do they burn? Do they burn your spirit? Who knows!

item.title: Terokkar Tussle, Part 6
item.description: That does it for Chapter 6. One more to go! It‚Äôs funny, but it‚Äôs looking like FDWL might possibly span the entire length of Warlords of Draenor. While it‚Äôs definitely not something we planned (FDWL actually started a few weeks before the Warlords announcement) it‚Äôs rather appropriate!

item.title: Terokkar Tussle, Part 5
item.description: Everyone knows the unspoken rules of pun battles! You should know better, Vid! Oh, and if you don‚Äôt remember what that thing is that hit the sphere, here‚Äôs a reminder. Can‚Äôt really blame you if you‚Äôve forgotten ‚Äî that was a year and a half ago, holy crap!

item.title: Terokkar Tussle, Part 3
item.description: Welp, I sure hope Vid got insurance, because those Golems are not cheap! It‚Äôs a little strange hearing all the news about the Legion alpha going on, when we‚Äôre still exploring the storyline of Mists here. Hopefully anyone reading this hasn‚Äôt forgotten about everything that happened back on Pandaria!

item.title: Terokkar Tussle, Part 2
item.description: And in this moment, Vid was reminded that Kura and Rades are siblings, after all‚Ä¶ Thanks for your patience, everyone! Right back into the action! As always, your comments and feedback is appreciated, or you can find us on Twitter!

item.title: Terokkar Tussle, Part 1
item.description: FIGHT! FIGHT! FIGHT! (Okay, the Sky Golem doesn‚Äôt technically have combat capabilities in-game. But it SHOULD. Look at those claws!)

item.title: Reunion
item.description: It‚Äôs been a long time since Rades and Vid have seen each other ‚Äì 42 pages, actually! That‚Äôs half the comic!!

item.title: Logistics
item.description: Engineers: Life‚Äôs finest problem-solvers!

item.title: Faith
item.description: And we‚Äôre finally back to the rest of the cast. üòÄ It‚Äôs been a while since we‚Äôve seen them!

item.title: Almost
item.description: Well, at least now Vid won‚Äôt have to feel bad about the Mechano-Hog getting destroyed. Speaking of, the real Vid sure was happy when she saw the script for this page, and realized she wouldn‚Äôt have to draw the motorcycles anymore! Which just means I suppose I‚Äôll have to give her something MORE complicated to draw now‚Ä¶

item.title: Exit Strategy
item.description: A few people were asking what Rades was pouring out of that bag back on Page #80 ‚Äî I told you it‚Äôd be explained! Granted, maybe he originally intended to use it just as a distraction, but I think it still served its purpose. (We also love seeing your comments trying to predict things that haven‚Äôt been revealed or explained yet in the story ‚Äî we always get a kick when you guess right!

item.title: We Always Hurt The Ones We Love
item.description: I guess Rades shouldn‚Äôt have turned such a blind eye to his sister‚Äôs behavior all those years ago.

item.title: Stealth Mission
item.description: First of all, curse you Blizzard for already using the funny joke! I‚Äôve always imagined Rades (the character) as more of a scout than a straight-up soldier, so it stands to reason he might be pretty sneaky. Not sneaky enough though, it seems‚Ä¶

item.title: Found
item.description: Annnnd we‚Äôre back! It‚Äôs been a great month off for us to get our batteries recharged, and we can‚Äôt wait to finish this story! It‚Äôs been a long undertaking, perhaps longer than either Vid or I initially realized, but we‚Äôre confident that in the end it‚Äôll be one we can look back on proudly. Now that Warlords‚Äô story has mostly been told, we can breathe a slight sigh of relief, as there was always the slight worry that some of the lore events might overlap or clash with what we had in mind with FDWL.

item.title: A Little Patience
item.description: Poor Vid. It looks like she‚Äôll be waiting awhile longer. Actually, you‚Äôll have to wait along with her a bit too because we are taking a vacation for the month of July! For many personal reasons, this year has been exhausting. I‚Äôm proud we were able to maintain our schedule throughout it, but I‚Äôm going on vacation in July and getting ahead on as many comics as we would‚Äôve needed just wasn‚Äôt feasible.

item.title: Orcient History
item.description: Aw yeah, going back to some old TBC lore! If you never quested through Nagrand as Horde, here‚Äôs a few links: http://wow.gamepedia.com/Jorin_Deadeye http://wow.gamepedia.com/Garrosh_Hellscream

item.title: Kura
item.description: I think one of our favorite things is designing new characters. Sure, it takes us forever because we usually have vastly different ideas about attire and equipment, and then naming them takes even longer as we toss ideas back and forth and examine existing naming conventions. But EVENTUALLY they get completed and then we can love them. üòÄ

item.title: Chapter 6: Anger
item.description: Hmm, the title for this Chapter is sort of fitting, given the temperature of the WoW community right now regarding some things. Things that ultimately will not affect FDWL or its characters, however! After all, they‚Äôre on Outland. Everything‚Äôs cool there.

item.title: Safe
item.description: That‚Äôs it for Chapter 5! Wrathion‚Äôs got some thinking to do. With that, think it‚Äôs about time for a change of scenery. Let‚Äôs get out of the mountains, and pay a visit to‚Ä¶oh, how about‚Ä¶the forest. Finally, thank you to our latest Patreon supporter, Allison! üòÄ

item.title: True Colors
item.description: I just noticed this week that the Sargerei mobs in Shadowmoon Valley (and the Sargerei Disguise toy) use a recolor of Sablemane‚Äôs outfit! The green and purple look‚Äôs not bad, but it doesn‚Äôt quite have the zing of Sablemane‚Äôs bright orange and red, in my opinion.

item.title: Trump Card
item.description: Sablemane may just come to regret antagonizing Wrathion so much. Oh, and in case you‚Äôre curious when Wrathion may have picked up one of those Ethereal spheres‚Ä¶ Page 32 Page 35

item.title: Dissolution
item.description: This arc has been a pretty rough emotional ride. It‚Äôs an unfortunate reality that this type of conversation isn‚Äôt exactly that uncommon between parent and child. In a perfect world, parents would be accepting of the choices their children make, regardless of whether or not they agree with them. But we all know that doesn‚Äôt always happen.

item.title: Irreconcilable Differences
item.description: ÔøΩ? In brighter news, Blizzard Watch has brought back its WoW webcomic link list! It‚Äôs called Webcomic Wrapup now ‚Äì if you want some more Warcraft (or related) webcomics in your life ‚Äì and why wouldn‚Äôt you! ‚Äì go check the list!

item.title: Ties
item.description: I imagine if any of us were in Vid‚Äôs shoes, deprived of our mounts, we‚Äôd find it a harsh awakening. I mean, going without flying mounts in Warlords has been tough enough! The 6.2 PTR just went live this week! Don‚Äôt worry, no spoilers here, but I will just say we‚Äôre pretty keenly interested to see how some of the datamined stuff turns out! FDWL obviously takes place on the original Outlands version of Draenor‚Ä¶but that doesn‚Äôt mean we‚Äôre not paying close attention to the lore and history being established in-game!

item.title: Interlude
item.description: LOOK AT THE CUTE BIRBS oh and also I guess there‚Äôs something going on with Rades.

item.title: Patch Notes!
item.description: Hey all, no FDWL update this week as Vid has some RL family stuff going on. (This isn‚Äôt an April First gag.) However, Blizzard did release their special patch notes for today! As always, they‚Äôre amazing. but also check out that first screenshot!! üòÄ FDWL will be back next week like normal ‚Äì think it‚Äôs maybe time to check in on Rades, we haven‚Äôt seen him in a while! Until then, have a great day, and as male Forsaken NPCs say, ‚ÄúTrust no one.

item.title: Family Business, Part Three
item.description: One of my favorite moments in Mists of Pandaria was after you‚Äôd completed Wrathion‚Äôs Legendary questline and defeated Garrosh, when you return to the Tavern in the Mists and get to watch Wrathion throw a temper tantrum. I liked it because of Tong ‚Äì how he finally has had enough and steps in and reprimands Wrathion for his childish behavior. Or to be precise, I enjoyed it because this NEVER HAPPENS.

item.title: Family Business, Part Two
item.description: Alternate title for today‚Äôs page: WRONGO

item.title: Family Business, Part One
item.description: Sablemane‚Äôs been chilling in Blade‚Äôs Edge for a while, but he‚Äôs still got contacts, visitors passing through. You really think he wouldn‚Äôt keep up-to-date with what‚Äôs going on back home?

item.title: Choices
item.description: After all that time in Highmaul, I can‚Äôt help but wonder about the ogres who, on OUR Draenor, ended up founding Ogri‚Äôla. They were such an interesting faction! I guess it wouldn‚Äôt really make sense to see them again in Warlords, since there is no area with such a prolific amount of Apexis crystals, the source of their increased intellect. At least‚Ä¶not yet, anyway. Many thanks to our latest patrons, William and Buglamp!

item.title: Glyph of Harsh Words
item.description: Erm, um, maybe that‚Äôs enough of Vid for now‚Ä¶let‚Äôs check in on someone else next week, shall we? Thank you to Pix for being our latest Patreon sponsor! If this is a cunning ploy to keep me from wreaking havoc in your D&D game, sorry, but no cigar.

item.title: Old Wounds
item.description: Poor Vid. That was a conversation that was simply never going to go well. Shout-out to our latest Patreon patrons, Laura, Linet, Hilde and Kelly! Thank you for your support! <3

item.title: Vidyala‚Äôs Story
item.description: WOW, RUDE Blackrock Foundry is live! Is your guild all set to take down Blackhand? I can‚Äôt wait to see what sort of interesting mechanics Blizzard throws at us this time. And it‚Äôs always exciting when you start collecting the first new tier set of an expansion! Thank you to our latest Patreon patrons, Orkchop, Kelsey and Nharzul! We appreciate your support! üòÄ Speaking of, we‚Äôve posted the December wallpapers to the Patreon site for our patrons to download and enjoy!

item.title: Broken
item.description: (In case you‚Äôre wondering what bridge she‚Äôs talking about, see #12: Where the Heart Is.) Thanks to our latest Patreon supporter, Maeli! üòÄ And thanks to everyone who stopped by the Livestream session yesterday! Hope you had a fun time hanging out!

item.title: Chapter Five: Fear
item.description: One of the most prevalent questions among fans when it comes to Wrathion and his crusade against the other black dragons is, ‚ÄúDoes he know about Sablemane?‚Äù And officially, no one knows. Wrathion seems to think he‚Äôs eliminated the rest of the Black Dragonflight‚Ä¶but we know he‚Äôs missed at least one. When we were planning out the FDWL storyline, Wrathion meeting Sablemane was one of our major plot points. And I‚Äôve had the above image in my head ever since, of a totally out-of-his-element Wrathion in Blade‚Äôs Edge, gazing up in frozen shock at those iconic stone spires and impaled black dragons overhead.

item.title: Guest of Honour
item.description: That wraps up Chapter Four! What does Sablemane want with Wrathion? What‚Äôs going to happen to Rades? What happened to Four? At least Vid‚Äôs received some happy news‚Ä¶ Speaking of Wrathion, I sure am curious what we‚Äôll see of him in Warlords. I believe his only appearance so far takes place ‚Äúoff-camera‚Äù, mentioned in Admiral Taylor‚Äôs Garrison Log, which doesn‚Äôt really tell us much. Clearly the Black Prince has SOMETHING in mind, SOME objective here on AU-Draenor.

item.title: DoT
item.description: Rades, you should know better than to travel with such an injury! But then again I suppose your options were rather limited. (Technically in-game Rades has maxed out First Aid, but let‚Äôs just assume that this type of wound is beyond the scope of a few bandages.) Many thanks to our latest Daily Quests, one of our favorite WoW comics, and tremor3258! üòÄ

item.title: Happy Winter Veil!
item.description: Hope everyone is enjoying the season and holidays! Vid and I are both traveling for Christmas, so no new strip next week, but in the meantime enjoy this bit of FDWL holiday art! And click here to enjoy it full-size! In other exciting news, thank you to Rachel for being our latest Patreon supporter! With this, we‚Äôve now reached our milestone goal to have a monthly wallpaper each month for all of our patrons!

item.title: What Goes Up
item.description: Poor Four. Brawler‚Äôs Guild just couldn‚Äôt really prepare her for what to do when hitchhiking on the back of an unwilling flying black dragon, I guess. Now, if only she were an engineer, she‚Äôd be fine here! A parachute cloak, or a goblin glider, and she‚Äôd be laughing. Sadly, Four is not an engineer. In other business, thank you to Jasyla for being our latest Patreon supporter! <3

item.title: The Light Reveals, Part Two
item.description: The funny thing about creating a weekly comic strip is that sometimes events take a little while to unfold. Though we‚Äôve had this particular moment Patreon supporters will forgive me for not showing the sketch for this page a day early as usual ‚Äì I didn‚Äôt want to spoil the final version! If you want to be further emotionally devastated today, Unbroken is necessary reading. We used much of the physical description of the process of becoming Broken from this short story to help determine what our important character should look like.

item.title: The Light Reveals, Part One
item.description: I wonder if we‚Äôll see any Broken this expansion. I know history has changed, and the orcs didn‚Äôt drink the blood of Mannoroth‚Ä¶but Gul‚Äôdan IS out there, green-skinned and demon-tainted. So there‚Äôs definitely fel magic on the table, albeit on a smaller scale ‚Äì for now, at least. And judging from the questlines, you KNOW Gul‚Äôdan has some pretty significant plans of his own meant to further his own schemes, and probably those of the Legion, who clearly still have their eyes on Draenor‚Ä¶

item.title: Be our guest
item.description: What an expensive bit of therapy. The engineer in me is crying. Hope everyone is enjoying Warlords so far! I know both Vid and I are LOVING all the new lore, familiar faces, and overall storyline. And GARRISONS! Oh my god, the garrisons. What more needs to be said. Now if you‚Äôll excuse me, I think it‚Äôs almost time to send my followers out on today‚Äôs missions.

item.title: The one that got away
item.description: Funny story about panel 5 on this page ‚Äì without meaning to, I had unconsciously modeled Four‚Äôs pose after Spider-Man comic I read twenty-four years ago. And then, after realizing this fact, I was able to identify, track down and download said comic to examine the angle of the pose. God bless the internet. IT‚ÄôS WARLORDS LAUNCH TOMORROW! If you‚Äôre taking the day off to enjoy it, make sure you have some snacks and drinks to keep you going!

item.title: More than you can chew
item.description: It‚Äôs like that Feist song. It‚Äôs Blizzcon time! Last time Vid and I were stunned with the announcement that WoW was returning to Draenor ‚Äì one might say ‚Äúwith love‚Äù ‚Äì so it‚Äôll be interesting to see what the big news and surprises are this time! It‚Äôs funny ‚Äì when the news about Warlords of Draenor hit, we were actually a little alarmed, wondering if it was going to affect FDWL‚Äôs storyline.

item.title: Eyes on the Prize
item.description: Okay, this isn‚Äôt exactly how Flare works in-game, but Rades IS an engineer, after all. This week‚Äôs patch notes were pretty funny, especially ‚ÄúThrall received a reminder that he is currently still on Azeroth.‚Äù Of course, instead of talking like he was already on Draenor, Thrall now talks like he‚Äôs back in Orgrimmar as Horde Warchief. Oh, Thrall. Vid got a Grand Expedition Yak this week, which means Transmog ANYWHERE, ANYTIME.

item.title: Righteous Defense
item.description: Somewhere, Protection Paladins are crying in remembrance.

item.title: The Nose Knows
item.description: When Vid & Rades were making their travel plans way back at the start of Chapter 2, there were some comments wondering about Sablemane and Wrathion. These queries continued when Sablemane actually showed up on page 25. Well, trust us, these two meeting and interacting has ALWAYS been one of the stories we‚Äôve wanted to tell in FDWL. They‚Äôre such interesting personalities, with such great potential! In other news, thanks to some very generous Patreon patrons, we‚Äôre looking to get our website looked at sometime soon!

item.title: Chapter Four: Hatred
item.description: And we‚Äôre back! What‚Äôs Sabellian here for? How is Rades doing? Why did the Broken stop? These answers and more, coming to a From Draenor near you! We also have some other, exciting news ‚Äì we‚Äôve started a Patreon account! Now don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì From Draenor With Love will always remain free for your reading enjoyment. However, working on the comic does take us a lot of time each week, and we do have operating costs such as web hosting, brushes, inks, etc.

item.title: Darkness, My Old Friend, Part 4
item.description: And that‚Äôs it for Chapter 3! >:D Things are getting real. Today‚Äôs page also marks a special occasion for FDWL ‚Äì it‚Äôs officially been one year since we started the story! We know this because it‚Äôs ALSO Siege of Orgrimmar‚Äôs one-year anniversary (which is‚Ä¶special‚Ä¶in its own way) and we specifically launched Chapter 1: Despair to coincide with the patch‚Äôs events. It‚Äôs been an exciting year for FDWL, and I think we‚Äôve definitely both learned a lot about the comic process, as well as simply what it takes to make a weekly webcomic work without killing each other.

item.title: Darkness, My Old Friend, Part 3
item.description: document.createElement('audio'); /media/042_angryriver.mp3 One of the side benefits of being friends with WoW players who a) passionately roleplay draenei; b) hate orcs; c) all of the above, is that when it comes time to write a Broken character who has a huge hate-on for orcs, I have a huge selection of angry dialogue samples ready-made to pull from. üòâ (As for said Broken, he is of course referring back to the events of Page #18.

item.title: Darkness, My Old Friend, Part 2
item.description: This week‚Äôs soundtrack: (I don‚Äôt know that we‚Äôll post a song for every page, but I figure if we have one that fits, we might as well!) Ah, the Broken. You can‚Äôt really delve into draenei and orc lore without visiting them. If you‚Äôre unfamiliar with Broken lore, you should absolutely go read Micky Neilson‚Äôs short story Unbroken. It‚Äôs a fantastic read. Just be warned that our Broken, are not necessarily like Nobundo‚Ä¶

item.title: Darkness, My Old Friend, Part 1
item.description: WELP Seems like Rades has worse luck than Vid, doesn‚Äôt it?

item.title: Employee Loyalty
item.description: Hey, it‚Äôs back to familiar territory! Personally, Zangarmarsh is my favorite zone in Outlands. The colours and environment is just so peaceful and soothing. Writing dialogue for Four can be tough, and I admit I struggled a bit with this page. She‚Äôs guarded, with a peculiar manner of speaking. This was a LOT for her to say. But I think it turned out well, and maybe explains a bit about her and just how she ended up with a Black Dragon for an employer.

item.title: Definitely Skull Level, Part 2
item.description: Would-be rogues know what Rades is talking about. With this (minor) delay out of the way, our party is able to make good time to the Dark Portal and reach Draenor. Shattrath is a few days away, so they settle down and make camp for the night‚Ä¶

item.title: Definitely Skull Level, Part 1
item.description: Is there anything more pitiful and/or annoying than running through a low level zone and accumulating a swarm of low-level grey mobs? It‚Äôs like, dudes, I‚Äôm just here to get some Goldthorn to level Alchemy, go away. And then they DAZE YOU and DISMOUNT YOU and suddenly you‚Äôre knee-deep in a sea of blood and linen cloth.

item.title: Starring Ice Cube
item.description: Random trivia ‚Äì this is the first FDWL strip (in the story arc format) that takes place on Azeroth! (Which makes sense, I suppose. It‚Äôs not called From Azeroth With Love.) On a similar note, it might seem a little odd that Rades & Vid have spent so much time in Pandaria as compared to Draenor, given our name. But this is about to change!

item.title: Ready Check
item.description: If you don‚Äôt recognize Four‚Äôs ‚Äúpet‚Äù, here‚Äôs a hint. Confused about the strange hooked shape of Wrathion‚Äôs dagger? That‚Äôs a type of knife called a white-quality vendor-purchased weapon. (This isn‚Äôt the one Wrathion has, of course. I doubt the Black Prince would be caught dead with an ordinary, mundane knife.)

item.title: When I asked if you had BG experience, I wasn‚Äôt talking about PVP
item.description: Confession: We realize the Tushui Alliance lion isn‚Äôt technically the symbol of the Brawler‚Äôs Guild, but the Brawler‚Äôs guild doesn‚Äôt actually HAVE a symbol! We checked the arena, the shirts, the NPCs, nothing. But you know what? Both Horde and Alliance began running their Brawler‚Äôs Guild at around the same time as the two Pandaren factions joined up, so maybe Aysa and Ji brought the tradition with them. (Shhhh, just go with it.

item.title: Four‚Äôs Company
item.description: Way, way back when we were planning out the FDWL plot, we knew that one of Wrathion‚Äôs bodyguards would become part of the story. Originally, I had penciled in Right, who ‚Äì along with her partner, Left ‚Äì can always be seen wherever their boss goes. I thought it would be fun to explore this cool, badass-looking woman, who despite numerous appearances in-game, never actually speaks or does anything. But after talking it over with Vid, we realized that while it would be interesting to use Right, we had a great opportunity to create a brand new person instead!

item.title: Three‚Äôs Company
item.description: Hmm, who could that be up there in the balcony, listening in? Guess we‚Äôll find out next week! üòÄ

item.title: The Ghost and the Darkness, Part 3
item.description: Standard hunter operating procedure 101! Everything seems to be proceeding quite nicely according to plan, doesn‚Äôt it?

item.title: The Ghost and the Darkness, Part 2
item.description: HAMMER OF JUSTICE!

item.title: The Ghost and the Darkness, Part 1
item.description: And what shoulder, & what art. Could twist the sinews of thy heart? And when thy heart began to beat, What dread hand? & what dread feet? ‚Äì The Tyger, William Blake This just in: Sha really are incredibly weird, gross and ugly little buggers, when you stop and look at them closely. They sure do match our color scheme though! üòâ

item.title: Chapter Three: Violence
item.description: And we‚Äôre back! Just a reminder that even though War Crimes just came out, and Garrosh‚Äôs trial is what‚Äôs ‚Äúcurrently‚Äù happening, FDWL takes place during the Siege of Orgrimmar timeframe. As for whether this is directly relevant? Well, let‚Äôs just say we‚Äôve both got the book and are pretty curious to see what all happens. üòâ

item.title: Unused FDWL Strip: Archimonde Crossing
item.description: We should be back with Chapter 3 next week! Until then, enjoy the script for a page we never ended up doing: Archimonde Crossing. When Animal Crossing: New Leaf came out, both Vid and I were enjoying it so much we wanted to do a FDWL comic about it. We had a few different ideas, including one about how hilarious it is when you shake a tree in Animal Crossing, hoping for money or furniture, and instead you get AN ANGRY SWARM OF BEES.

item.title: Any Similarities are Purely Coincidental
item.description: I just want everyone to know that I combed the Auction House for weeks looking for Ethereum Prison Keys, for reference & accuracy. And they didn‚Äôt help at all. So we came up with something new for the prison spheres, something that would make sense with their role in ethereal society, and with where we encounter them in Blade‚Äôs Edge and Netherstorm. And of course, something that may seem a little familiar.

item.title: The Exchange
item.description: You know what they say: Every ethereal has his price. And remember, these Ethereum guys, they‚Äôre way out of date on their gemstones! Cardinal Rubies, Amberjewels, Lapis Lazulis, Queen‚Äôs Garnets, Primal Diamonds‚Ä¶we‚Äôre talking like, three whole expansions‚Äô worth of exciting new jewels to covet! What self-respecting ethereal could resist such an offer? üòâ Next week will mark the end of Chapter 2! After that, we‚Äôll be taking a short break for some RL vacations and script planning, but we‚Äôll be back before you know it!

item.title: Old Friends
item.description: Vid‚Äôs turn! üòâ For those unfamiliar with what Rades is talking about, he‚Äôs referring to the fact that Rexxar, Vol‚Äôjin and Chen are old war buddies. Years ago (in Warcraft III) they fought together, for Thrall‚Äôs Horde, against the then-leader of Theramore, Daelin Proudmoore (Jaina‚Äôs father), who hated the Horde and wanted to respark the Horde-Alliance war. Considering the situation and players involved in the Siege of Orgrimmar, it seems a bit of a similar situation.

item.title: Let‚Äôs Make a Deal
item.description: Does anyone actually go back to Gezhe each month and get their monthly Membership Benefits? I don‚Äôt, and yet I feel like I almost should ‚Äì the Outlands phase of leveling Jewelcrafting is always such a pain, since those gems are so scarce, and Golden Draenite is actually fairly valuable. And more importantly, I DID do all that work for the Consortium back in the day ‚Äì I EARNED those gems!

item.title: Nagrand Slam
item.description: My favorite moment when crafting a story (such as in a D&D campaign) comes when finally, after months of straightforward, introductory play, all the setup stuff is complete. The plot hooks have been put into play, the important characters have been established, and the overarching story is just starting to pick up speed. I‚Äôve been extra excited about FDWL lately, because I think we‚Äôre at that step. Fun times ahead!

item.title: Behind the Scenes!
item.description: Because this Monday was my birthday and I was going out of town on the weekend, I asked Rades if we could take a week off the ‚Äúregular‚Äù comic! We agreed to do it and just have something for filler. I thought that especially since I now do most of the comic on paper that it might be interesting for you to see where I do it and what it looks like from my end.

item.title: A Class-ic Mistake
item.description: We don‚Äôt use colour in our pages that often, but man, when we do, it‚Äôs sure a nice contrast with the black & white panels! I don‚Äôt know about you, but I would totally craft a hot pink Sky Golem in-game and fly around in it. This week‚Äôs page is actually canonical ‚Äì it‚Äôs Vid‚Äôs birthday next week! The real Vid, I mean! So be sure to wish her well. To celebrate, she‚Äôs going out of town, so there won‚Äôt be an actual comic page next week.

item.title: Balance
item.description: It of course goes without saying that this song was listened to by both Vid and I during the making of this strip, given the presence of a certain talking chandelier. ‚ÄúMany lives were lost to bring you these tab collars.‚Äù

item.title: Teamwork
item.description: OLD DRAENEI OLD DRAENEI WITH CANES (CANE-EI)

item.title: City of Trite
item.description: I‚Äôd like to tell you that eventually mangling draenic phrases gets old, but I‚Äôd be lying. It‚Äôs one of my favorite things to do. But it‚Äôs not just me! After reading the script, Vid told me she‚Äôs always liked the one that sounds like ‚Äúbuy your niece a car.‚Äù I can‚Äôt wait until Warlords of Draenor where we‚Äôll get even more expressions to abuse!

item.title: Random Encounter
item.description: It‚Äôs the scene from the Chapter Title page, oooooh! Sharp-eyed readers may notice something telling on that page now, too. But what does it mean?? Time will tell. One of the most interesting things about writing FDWL is discussing scenes, and realizing how the events in the comic are letting us establish little character traits about Vid & Rades. We had a good laugh when realizing what type of person Vid (the character) is when she‚Äôs on watch.

item.title: Memory Lane
item.description: After getting swamped last week and falling a bit behind schedule, Vid and I sat down this week and tossed some ideas around on how we could streamline the comic process a little. We realized that something that would help us out a great deal would be adopting a cleaner, more ‚Äúinked‚Äù look. It‚Äôll be a bit of a change from the pages so far, but I‚Äôve always thought Vid‚Äôs art looked super sharp when in the inked-page step, so I‚Äôm actually really glad everyone is getting to see it now!

item.title: Bonus Colour Keys
item.description: Work and life stuff hit us both pretty hard this past week and unfortunately we weren‚Äôt able to get the comic finished. This doesn‚Äôt happen very often and we‚Äôd like to build some buffer, but for now we‚Äôd prefer not to rush the comic and have the quality suffer. So what are you looking at, then? Back towards the end of Chapter One, Rades and I discussed at length to have a wardrobe change in Chapter Two.

item.title: Symbols
item.description: Aw yiss, inventing us some headcanon draenei lore! Observant readers may remember that we alluded to these personal symbols back in Vid‚Äôs character profile. If you look at official WoW artwork, there are TONS of different draenei sigils/symbols depicted. Why ARE they different? Do they represent different magical abilities? Or is it like we‚Äôve described here, something biological, like an individual‚Äôs unique DNA footprint? Personally, I think it‚Äôs a lot cooler to imagine those symbols as displays of personal identity rather than just to indicate ‚ÄúI‚Äôm using magic.

item.title: Hit M for Map
item.description: Where‚Äôs the TomTom addon when you need it?

item.title: Chapter Two: Doubt
item.description: Happy New Year, everyone! On to chapter two! I worried how recognizable Zangarmarsh would be in black & white, without those soft, tranquil shades of blue ‚Äì but I suppose those giant mushrooms are pretty distinctive. I‚Äôve always loved Zangarmarsh, it‚Äôs probably my favorite Burning Crusade zone. Not necessarily for the quests or anything ‚Äì it‚Äôs just so soothing and calming visually. Will that carry over for comic-Vid and Rades? I guess you‚Äôll have to wait and find out!

item.title: Bonus Happy Winter Veil!
item.description: Happy Winter Veil, everyone! Hope Robo-Greatfather Winter is nice to you this year!

item.title: Bonus Character Profile: Vidyala
item.description: And now, Vid‚Äôs turn for the character development questionnaire!

item.title: Bonus Character Profile: Rades
item.description: There‚Äôs been a fun little a good cook, too.) Obviously, we don‚Äôt want to devote 30 days to this, and some of the questions didn‚Äôt really work for characters answering it about themselves, so the FDWL version of this survey is only 21 questions. Check back next week‚Äôs for Vid‚Äôs answers!

item.title: Pieces
item.description: ‚Äú‚Ä¶Why did you play that piece just now?‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a Pandaren board game. The object is for both players to win.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs ridiculous! Why would you even play!?‚Äù That‚Äôs it for Chapter One! The groundwork is set, the plot points have been laid out. Now ‚Äì rubs hands together eagerly ‚Äì it‚Äôs time to have some fun. We will be taking a short break before starting in on the next leg of the story, to allow for Christmas holidays and whatnot.

item.title: Where The Heart Is
item.description: Y‚Äôknow, I asked Vid to do something special artistically for the middle two panels, and HOLY CRAP did she nail it! Those panels might be my favorite artwork in all of FDWL so far. Next week will mark the end of our first chapter! (Will all chapters be the same length? We don‚Äôt know yet.) We hope you‚Äôve been enjoying the story so far! Now that we‚Äôve laid the groundwork, it‚Äôs time to get this show on the road!

item.title: Quest Accepted
item.description: I always find it funny when our plot details are actually accurate/based off the real characters. For example, Rades the WoW toon really IS an honorary member of the Consortium, having reached Exalted status with them way, way back (I think I wanted the tabard? or maybe one of their engineering schematics). On the other hand, Vid never did the rep grind for them, and we‚Äôll see this reflected later on in the comic.

item.title: Naar-who?
item.description: Look at us! Blizzcon week and not even missing a beat? YEAH! But seriously, Vid worked like a maniac to get a few strips done ahead of time, so she definitely earned the vacation time! It certainly wouldn‚Äôt have been the end of the world to have a filler strip or two, but we‚Äôre pretty pleased that we didn‚Äôt have to resort to that! As for Blizzcon itself ‚Äì WOW! Exciting stuff!

item.title: The Magic Word
item.description: It‚Äôs Blizzcon week! Hope everyone who‚Äôs attending the con or watching via Virtual Ticket has a great time! If you‚Äôre there, keep an eye out for Vid ‚Äì she‚Äôll be the one with a bunch of FDWL stickers and business cards! üòâ

item.title: Awkward
item.description: One of the hazards in being an insatiably curious two-year-old dragon and knowing very little about history is not recognizing the kind of questions you simply do not ask in civilized company. Some readers have asked us for a while now about Vid and Rades and their connection to Draenor, so here‚Äôs a few answers!

item.title: Attention Span
item.description: Something you should know about engineers: we‚Äôre constantly keeping an eye out for cliffs, staircases and towers to hurl ourselves from that we might use our gadgets to float safely to the ground in style. Ask the engineer in your raid. They‚Äôll verify this.

item.title: Oh, It‚Äôs You
item.description: If you think about it, Wrathion probably IS pretty bothered by what happened to the Vale. It‚Äôs just a stone‚Äôs throw away from the Tavern in the Mists! That has to be horrible for property values.

item.title: It Probably Happens A Lot
item.description: Hunters know what I‚Äôm talking about. LOOKING AT YOU, KRUSH.

item.title: Not Again
item.description: Aw yeah, sticking to our own vaguely-established continuity! üòâ

item.title: All Roads Lead to Orgrimmar
item.description: DIALOGUE YAY Oh Garrosh, look at all the trouble you‚Äôre causing.

item.title: Repercussions
item.description: Starting to get underway! The impact of Garrosh‚Äôs actions in the Vale. Major events are about to be set in motion. Apologies for the disarray of the site design right now. We updated the WordPress version and it broke everything, just like it ALWAYS DOES (seriously, it actually breaks every time we update) but thankfully the damage doesn‚Äôt seem TOO severe this time. Hopefully it shouldn‚Äôt be too long before we get everything back to how it should be.

item.title: Chapter One: Despair
item.description: It‚Äôs an exciting day for From Draenor With Love! After nearly two years of making this comic, we felt we were ready to tackle some new challenges. What does this mean? Our name is staying the same. The comic will still be about Rades and Vid. It will be an ongoing story from week to week. The format will be less static four-panel and more graphic novel. I also made some changes personally, going back to my roots a bit as it were to ink the comic by hand rather than entirely digitally.

item.title: Behind the Scenes Part 3: Production
item.description: For a larger version of today‚Äôs strip, click here. This is part 3 of 3 of our Behind the Scenes series! Next week we‚Äôll have something‚Ä¶suitable, for the looming 5.4 patch. And then after that it‚Äôll be SOMETHING ENTIRELY NEW AND EXCITING! We‚Äôre going to be trying something new so we hope you enjoy it!

item.title: Behind the Scenes Part 2: Art
item.description: Last week, Rades explained the process of how he scripts and sometimes storyboards a FDWL script! This week I‚Äôm going to be telling you about how I do the sketching and art. For a larger version of today‚Äôs strip, click here! The following is a transcript of text from the above image. It‚Äôs worth noting that over the time we‚Äôve been doing this I have simplified the art a fair bit to save time.

item.title: Behind the Scenes Part 1: Script
item.description: For a larger version of today‚Äôs strip, click here. For a text version, well, read on! Everyone‚Äôs busy preparing for patch 5.4 and the Siege of Orgrimmar, and we‚Äôre no exception! We‚Äôre working on some significant changes to FDWL that you can expect to see when the patch goes live. For now, we thought we‚Äôd share a bit of the creative process and show just how we do this comic thing!

item.title: Peons Are People Too
item.description: I totally get the Darkspear Rebellion, the disruption of the Kor‚Äôkron war engine, the stealing of valuable resources for the upcoming siege on Orgrimmar. That all makes sense. And if we have to take out a few Kor‚Äôkron Commanders or Goblin Mercenaries while we‚Äôre at it? Sure. No argument here. But the workers? What did they ever do to us? They‚Äôre just laborers! Red-collar working-class civilians. They‚Äôre just doing their 9 to 5, cutting up meat, chopping down trees, and suddenly we fly in on our giant cosmic dragons, beat ‚Äôem up, blow up their machines, and then take all their stuff.

item.title: An Unfortunate Turnip of Events
item.description: Remember the good old days in the first month of Mists, when carrots, lettuce and leeks were flying off the Auction House faster than you could list them, and for outrageous prices? I don‚Äôt even remember exactly, but weren‚Äôt they going for like 100 gold each? 100 GOLD PER TURNIP. And raiders who adamantly insisted they needed the best buff foods possible were crafting those banquets requiring 50 turnips at a time.

item.title: The Mogu Menace
item.description: Kill 10 Mogu. Kill 8 more Mogu. Hey guess what? Kill a dozen more. I wonder just how many Mogu we‚Äôve taken out in our time here? All these Mogu-slaying dailies HAVE to be taking a toll on their population. Hell, I‚Äôve slaughtered a few thousand alone. Kill Mogu for Valor, kill Mogu for reputation, kill Mogu because they‚Äôre in the way while doing Archaeology‚Ä¶name a reason, and we‚Äôve probably killed a Mogu for it.

item.title: Insert Emotion Here
item.description: When we wrote this joke in our script page three weeks ago, little did we know that the ‚ÄúSha of ____‚Äù joke would become so popular and so prolific before we had a chance to publish. Ah well, live and learn. There really are unlimited possibilities when it comes to these other, lesser-known Sha. And if they really are manifestation of our emotions, would there not be one for our increasingly weary attitudes about dailies, or the utterly-minor-but-totally-palpable sense of irritation at seeing half a dozen ‚ÄúWiggling‚Äù and ‚ÄúAlluring‚Äù crops that you‚Äôre going to have to deal with?

item.title: Player Versus Panda
item.description: Have you seen the Mists of Pandaria trailer yet? If not, WHY NOT? Seriously though. It‚Äôs no wonder they‚Äôre scared. This invincible ninja bear just flew out of the mists, kicking their ass, parrying their combined attacks‚Ä¶ Oh, and also, he‚Äôs level 90. IT‚ÄôS PVP GANKFESTS IN STRANGLETHORN VALE ALL OVER AGAIN, OH GOD RUN AWAY

item.title: Yak in Business
item.description: Disappointment was high on the Mists beta this week, as the price of the Grand Expedition Yak skyrocketed to 120,000 gold. If you think about it though, the price hike makes total sense! The ethereals aren‚Äôt the sort of people to let this kind of potential profit slip through their bandage-fingers. And besides, with the yak‚Äôs portable reforger making their Orgrimmar/Stormwind services obsolete, they‚Äôd actually be losing money! Ethereal interference aside, have you SEEN how much stuff is on one of these yaks?
